name: Max XP
description_md: This deck is totally legal* for standalone! ###### *with the removal of one small sentence in the rules manual Much of the card choices are dictated by the axiom MAX XP, but there are still a few decisions to be made: * Customizable box selection, esp [FILP](/card/09060)/[Grizzled](/card/09101)/[Raven Quill](/card/09042) traits * 1 Covenant: [Blasphemous](/card/07113) * 3 L2 skills (for [Ancestral Knowledge](/card/07303), after the 7 L3 skills): 2 [Deduction](/card/02150), 1 [Fearless](/card/02268) * 23 L3 cards: * 2 Tricks (for [Bewitching](/card/10079), after [Ace in the Hole](/card/02266)): [Confound](/card/10057), [Vamp](/card/10081) * 2 Tactics/Supplies (for [STTP](/card/03264), after [Custom Ammo](/card/04193)): [eCache](/card/03239), [Dynamite](/card/60129) * 9 Illicit (for [UWM](/card/09077), after [Damning Testimony](/card/09059)): 2 [Thieves' Kit](/card/09075), 2 [Lupara](/card/03309), 2 [.45 Thompson](/card/05187) (), 2 [Tennessee Sour Mash](/card/05190) (), 1 [Dirty Deeds](/card/10080) * 1 Tarot (for [Kaslow](/card/05283)): [The Fool â€¢ 0](/card/54011) * 6 filtered draw: 2 each of [Scroll of Secrets](/card/05188) (), [Old Book of Lore](/card/06279), [LCC](/card/60326) * 2 resource gen/stats: [Crafty](/card/08123) * 1 stats: [Crystalline Elder Sign](/card/04235) Weaknesses (as of FHV): After removing the 5 class-specific, 6 campaign-only, and 4 multiplayer-only weaknesses, 48 RBWs should remain. (All 48 are included in the decklist here.) You only need 44 of them, so remove 4 at random. Remember that 3 of those 48 are permanents, so you do have to peek at your pulls at least a little. If you're inflicting this on a team, then (a) for shame, and (b) you'll need to *first* add the 4 multiplayer-only RBWs (in the side deck) and *then* remove 8 at random (to get back down to 44 total). ___ Playing the deck: * (Remove the extra weaknesses, if you haven't already) * Before setting up: draw tarots for [Observed](/card/54013), and probably [Damned](/card/54014) * Build side-decks: 10 illicits under [UWM](/card/09077), 3 tricks under [Bewitching](/card/10079), 3 tactics/supplies under [STTP](/card/03264), and 5 random skills under [AK](/card/07303) (so 21 total cards set aside) * Starting $: Probably 5$ ([ADAD](/card/05278)s cancel [Indebted](/card/02037)s), but possibly 7$ or even 9$ if you happened to randomly remove Indebted(s) * Mulligan: 7 cards (thanks to 2x [Studious](/card/05276)) out of the remaining 56 (35+[15](/card/08031)+2x[5](/card/06167)+[10](/card/09077)+[5](/card/07303)+[2](/card/03018) - 21) nonweaknesses, hopefully avoiding the 4 tarot weaknesses. Probably hard mulligan for filtered draw! * The rest of the game: After mulligan (depending on how many tarot weaknesses you drew in the opener), your deck will contain 49-53 player cards and 37-44 weaknesses (depending on how many permanent weaknesses you pulled). That amounts to your deck being ~45% weaknesses, which means that [FL](/card/08031) is going to brick your upkeep draw ~70% of the time. In other words, you mostly need to lean on your opening tableau of permanents and side-decks, plus your opening hand, while the scenario *and your own deck* try to defeat you.
